intro: Diplodiscus longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved diplodiscus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Diplodiscus longifolius is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
